title: Scales of electric and gravitational forces

content.question: Students want to figure out which force, the gravitational force or the electric force, has more impact at different scales in the universe. They choose two scenarios: a hydrogen atom consisting of a proton and an electron, and a solar system consisting of a star and a single planet. Which of the following best describes which force has more impact at each of these two scales?

choices.label: Hydrogen Atom Solar System Electric Gravitational
Hydrogen Atom Solar System Electric Electric
Hydrogen Atom Solar System Gravitational Electric
Hydrogen Atom Solar System Neither. Both forces have equal impact. Neither. Both forces have equal impact.

content.answer: Hydrogen Atom Solar System Electric Gravitational

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
